intro: Matayba melchioriana, commonly known as the yellow matayba, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of South America. The tree produces small, round fruits that are typically orange to reddish in color when mature. The plant has a shallow root system and prefers well-drained soil, making it suitable for cultivation in warm, tropical climates.
